text:
Hello! Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Today is really special because it is New Years!
So I Thought, I am going to make

a very special Nerdy Nummies today, I am gonna
make champagne cupcakes,

from scratch! And decorate ‘em with some
Nerds! Ah-ah-ah-ah-ah!
OK, let’s get started!

The things that you will need today, will
be: First of all, champagne, you’re gonna

want a sweet champagne, not a dry champagne,
so you can pick any brand that

you’d like. Then you’ll need baking soda,
baking powder, 1 stick of butter,

2 eggs, sour cream, sugar, flour, salt and
vanilla extract.

And, on a side note, if you want to make these
non-alcoholic, that’s fine too,
you can use Martinelli’s Sparkling Cider.

To start you’re gonna need 3 mixing bowls,
I have the largest 1 in the middle,

then a medium and a small, berrp! We’re
gonna start with the middle 1.

You’re supposed to keep these separate,
for science, I’m not exactly sure why,
but, that’s OK!

So you’re gonna put 1 stick of butter, you
want to make sure it’s a little bit soft, so you

can put it in the microwave for a little bit
if you’d like.

1 stick of butter, then you’re gonna take
1 cup of sugar,
oh gosh!
Oh they really don’t make these very big!
There we go!

Then you’re gonna take your whisk, and just
mix that around until it’s fluffy.

And then once it’s mixed you’re gonna
add the 2 eggs.

Oh my! This butter wasn’t soft enough! So
I’m gonna add an egg a little bit early!
Yeah.
Alright, nice!
Then add your second egg.

And then you’re gonna add 2 tablespoons
of vanilla extract.
Pfft-pfft!

And put lots of hair in your mouth! Because
that’s the way to bake!
1 Teaspoon, a 2 teaspoons!
Mix that around, till it looks like that!

Now I’m gonna put this out of the way, and
we’re gonna start with all of our
dry substances.

You’re gonna need 1-3/4 flour, cups of flour.
Then you’re gonna do 1/2 a teaspoon

of baking soda. Then use 1/4 a teaspoon of
baking powder.
And, 1/4 a teaspoon of salt.

Then you’re gonna take your whisk again
and mix that all together.

Now in the last little bowl we’re gonna
mix the champagne and sour cream

together. You’re gonna take 1/2 cup of sour
cream. Just take a big scoop, just

kind of eyeball it. Eh, that’s pretty good!
Put it in there.

Alright, now we’re gonna open the champagne
and we’re gonna pour in 1/2

a cup of champagne. Oh man, I haven’t opened
1 of these in a long time, so…
I think you just twist this little thing off…

First take that off there and then you…
Push it up, on here.

I don’t know how you do, open this… I think
you just…
AHHHHHHHHH!

Then you’re gonna pour 1/2 a cup of sweet
champagne, dump it in, and hear the

fizzle, fizzle, fizzles! And then you’re
just gonna mix it together and it
kind of ends up looking like milk.

Now we’re gonna do some science. We’re
gonna take the big bowl, and put it in

the middle, and you’re gonna alternate putting
in the dry, put in a little bit of

flour, and you want to start with the flour
because we have more flour mixture
than we do the champagne mixture.
Then mix, mix, mix!

And then, we’ll put in the champagne mixture.
Little bit of champagne.
It’s kinda like milk, sort of, lookin.
Mix that in.

I love these cupcakes, they’re so good,
they’re not too sweet, so when you

put the sweet frosting on top, it’s just,
just perfect!
Just perfect! They’re so yummy!

Once your batter is all done, we’re gonna
preheat the oven to 325 and we’re gonna
bake these for about 15 minutes.
You’re gonna take your little scoops, the big scooper. And just put it in there.
I like to take a secondspoon and just push it out.

This batter is a little thick, so, it’s really easy
to work with.

One of the concerns that I had was, I was
like, well I usually drink dry champagne,

I don’t really like really sweet, sweet cupcakes.
But the reason you want to use a sweet

champagne is because the batter is so bland.
And, even when you bite into these

cupcakes when they’re all done, they’re
really not that sweet, it’s the frosting

that’s gonna make them really sweet, so
don’t be afraid to use a very sweet
champagne! Something very fruity!

First batch is ready to go! Let’s put these
in the oven and while these are baking,
let’s make the frosting!

First you’re gonna need 4 cups of powdered
sugar,
1, ooh! This stuff is messy!

Change into your New Years outfit after you
make these!
1 stick of butter.

Again, put it in the microwave so it’s nice
and soft and mushy like that.
Nice and messy!

And this time, we’re gonna do 1/4 cup of
champagne, just a little bit of saucy.

It’s kind of like soda, then you’re gonna
need 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
Then we’re just gonna mix it together.

Da-da! Once your cupcakes are all done baking,
take them out of the oven,

and make sure they’ve had plenty of time
to cool before you frost. And our

frosting is also done, so we’re gonna pour
this into a plastic bag and then

decorate the top and sprinkle little Nerd
candies on top!
Meee!
Let’s get frosting!

I put the frosting in this plastic bag, and
I have this really big tip, for little

fancy cupcakes. And all you’re gonna do,
is put it on top, make a circle.
Boop!
Go to the next 1.
Outline, work your way in, boop!
Now just take your Nerds and make it rain!

I make it rain! I make it rain! I make it
rain! I make it rain!

I make it rain! I make it rain! I make it
rain! I make it rain!
I am so messy, oh my god!

I am the messiest baker. But that’s OK!
Bakers gonna bake!

Ta-da! We finished our little champagne Nerdy
Cupcakes, and for an extra surprise,

I put these little glasses on top. I printed
out a little picture of the

glasses, put wax paper over them, and then
traced, with royal icing, which is

cookie frosting, and then let them sit out
for 24 hours. I wasn’t sure if they
were gonna work, but they did!

And I thought, aw! This will make them just
a little bit more Nerdy-er!

Little bit more Geeky-er! I love ‘em they’re
so cute!

If you have any other suggestions for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please leave me

a comment below and I will do my best to make
it happen.

Also, Nerdy Nummies comes out every Tuesday,
so don’t forget to subscribe!
And, Happy New Year! Pew-pew-pew-pew-pew-pew-pew!

I hope you liked these Geeky Champagne Cupcakes,
I love them, they’re so cute!
OK, bye-bye!
Meep!
